reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Supporting Rwanda Towards Reducing TB and HIV-related Morbidity and Mortality

description.narrative: Rwanda - TB/HIV - Ministry of Health of the Republic of Rwanda - MOH. This program has the following goals: New HIV infections are reduced by 2024. HIV related deaths and comorbidities are reduced and HIV morbidity is decreased. People infected and affected by HIV have the same opportunities as the general population. 57% reduction in TB deaths (compared with 2015) by 2024. 35% reduction in TB incidence rate (compared with 2015) by 2024. TBD affected families facing catastrophic costs due to tuberculosis. The objectives of this program are: New infection in children are maintained below 5%. New HIV infections by sexual transmission reduced. The coverage of ART and the VL suppression among PLHIV on treatment are increased. PLHIV have reduced morbidity related to STI, OI and other co-morbidities. People infected and affected by HIV and MVC have improved socio-economic status and protection. SGBV and HIV related stigma and discrimination are reduced. Considering the Patient Pathway for Tuberculosis. Targeted approaches for key drivers of TB epidemic and selected populations. Programme management, multi-Sectoral collaboration & engaging all care providers. Universal Health Coverage, social protection, human rights & gender, nutrition. Stable and quality assured supply of drugs, diagnostics and commodities. M&E and data quality system (e-TB, health information system, Civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) system

The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
TCS- Other 1: Percentage of people living with HIV on ART, who have suppressed viral load at 12 months ( VL <1000 copies/ml)
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
PMTCT - Other 1: Percentage of exposed infants who are HIV-free by 24 months
TCS- Other 2: Percentage of adults and children with HIV known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
SD Other-1: Percent of health facilities offering Case based surveillance and index testing services
TCP-Other 1: Proportion of TB cases notified in high-risk groups among all TB cases
Number of medical male circumcisions performed according to national standards
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
TCP-Other 2: Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
